results.title: The effects of ICI 118,587 and atenolol on the responses to exercise and on breathlessness in healthy subjects.
results.text_hl: The effects of @CHEMICAL_Xamoterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017307 @@@ICI 118,587@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on the responses to exercise and on @<m>DISEASE_Dyspnea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004417 @@@breathlessness@@@ in healthy subjects.

citations.NLM: O'Neill PA, Morton PB, Sharman P, Marlow HF, Stark RD. The effects of ICI 118,587 and atenolol on the responses to exercise and on breathlessness in healthy subjects. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1984 Jan;17(1):37-41. PMID: 6229263
citations.BibTeX: @article{6229263, title={The effects of ICI 118,587 and atenolol on the responses to exercise and on breathlessness in healthy subjects.}, author={O'Neill PA and Morton PB and Sharman P and Marlow HF and Stark RD}, journal={Br J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={17}, number={1}, pages={37-41}}

results.title: Submaximal, but not maximal, exercise testing detects differences in the effects of beta-blockers during treadmill exercise: a study of celiprolol and atenolol. II.
results.text_hl: During the early stages of exercise, treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ was also associated with higher scores for the subjective indices of @<m>DISEASE_Dyspnea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004417 @@@breathlessness@@@ and @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@.

citations.NLM: McLenachan JM, Grant S, Ford I, Henderson E, Dargie HJ. Submaximal, but not maximal, exercise testing detects differences in the effects of beta-blockers during treadmill exercise: a study of celiprolol and atenolol. II. Am Heart J. 1991 Feb;121(2 Pt 2):691-6. PMID: 1671188
citations.BibTeX: @article{1671188, title={Submaximal, but not maximal, exercise testing detects differences in the effects of beta-blockers during treadmill exercise: a study of celiprolol and atenolol. II.}, author={McLenachan JM and Grant S and Ford I and Henderson E and Dargie HJ}, journal={Am Heart J}, volume={121}, number={2 Pt 2}, pages={691-6}}

results.title: Effect of cibenzoline and atenolol administration on dynamic left ventricular obstruction due to sigmoid-shaped septum.
results.text_hl: In both cases, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ administration decreased rest pressure gradient.

citations.NLM: Ozaki K, Sakuma I, Mitsuma K, Suzuki T, Tsuchida K, Takahashi K, Miida T, Oda H. Effect of cibenzoline and atenolol administration on dynamic left ventricular obstruction due to sigmoid-shaped septum. Circ J. 2008 Dec;72(12):2087-91. PMID: 18854617
citations.BibTeX: @article{18854617, title={Effect of cibenzoline and atenolol administration on dynamic left ventricular obstruction due to sigmoid-shaped septum.}, author={Ozaki K and Sakuma I and Mitsuma K and Suzuki T and Tsuchida K and Takahashi K and Miida T and Oda H}, journal={Circ J}, volume={72}, number={12}, pages={2087-91}}

results.title: [Short-term course under beta blockers of clinical and echocardiographic parameters in mitral stenosis in sinus rhythm].
results.text_hl: It is a prospective study performed on 26 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who have had a clinical and echocardiographic assessment before and 15 days after treatment by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@. After 15 days of beta-blocker treatment, there is a significant improvement of @<m>DISEASE_Dyspnea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004417 @@@dyspnea@@@ (57.6% in class III or IV before beta-blockade versus 15.3% with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@; P = 0.001) and a significant decrease of the heart rate (83.3 +/- 15.2 versus 68.9 +/- 13.9; P = 0.001) and the diastolic blood pressure (8 mmHg +/- 1.3 versus 7.2 mmHg +/- 0.9; P = 0.01).

citations.NLM: Kane A, Djamadar SY, Affangla A, Diop IB, Sarr M, Ba SA, Diouf SM. [Short-term course under beta blockers of clinical and echocardiographic parameters in mitral stenosis in sinus rhythm]. Ann Cardiol Angeiol (Paris). 2000 Oct;49(7):397-402. PMID: 12555492
citations.BibTeX: @article{12555492, title={[Short-term course under beta blockers of clinical and echocardiographic parameters in mitral stenosis in sinus rhythm].}, author={Kane A and Djamadar SY and Affangla A and Diop IB and Sarr M and Ba SA and Diouf SM}, journal={Ann Cardiol Angeiol (Paris)}, volume={49}, number={7}, pages={397-402}}

results.title: Angina, ischemia, and effort tolerance with vasodilating beta-blockers.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Celiprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017272 @@@Celiprolol@@@ did reduce exercise-induced @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@, but there was no reduction in cardiac output at rest or on exercise compared with placebo. Compared with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Celiprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017272 @@@celiprolol@@@ produced less @<m>DISEASE_Dyspnea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004417 @@@dyspnea@@@ and @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ at submaximal levels of exercise.

citations.NLM: Dargie HJ, Grant S, McLenachan J. Angina, ischemia, and effort tolerance with vasodilating beta-blockers. Am Heart J. 1991 Mar;121(3 Pt 2):1017-20. PMID: 1671726
citations.BibTeX: @article{1671726, title={Angina, ischemia, and effort tolerance with vasodilating beta-blockers.}, author={Dargie HJ and Grant S and McLenachan J}, journal={Am Heart J}, volume={121}, number={3 Pt 2}, pages={1017-20}}

results.title: Positional central apnea and vascular medullary compression.
results.text_hl: A 66-year-old man with @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ presented with complaints of @DISEASE_Disorders_of_Excessive_Somnolence @DISEASE_MESH:D006970 @@@excessive daytime sleepiness@@@ (Epworth Sleepiness Score 14/24), @<m>DISEASE_Dyspnea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004417 @@@dyspnea@@@ upon exertion, and episodes of noninjurious dream-enacting behavior.

citations.NLM: DelRosso L, Gonzalez-Toledo E, Chesson AL Jr, Hoque R. Positional central apnea and vascular medullary compression. Neurology. 2012 Nov 20;79(21):2156-7. PMID: 23136263
citations.BibTeX: @article{23136263, title={Positional central apnea and vascular medullary compression.}, author={DelRosso L and Gonzalez-Toledo E and Chesson AL Jr and Hoque R}, journal={Neurology}, volume={79}, number={21}, pages={2156-7}}

results.title: Provokable left ventricular outflow tract obstruction in a patient without hypertrophy.
results.text_hl: BACKGROUND: A 61-year-old man presented with @<m>DISEASE_Dyspnea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004417 @@@shortness of breath@@@ and @DISEASE_Chest_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@ on exertion.

citations.NLM: Pasquale F, Tomé-Esteban MT, Morgagni R, Elliott P. Provokable left ventricular outflow tract obstruction in a patient without hypertrophy. Nat Rev Cardiol. 2009 Apr;6(4):313-6. PMID: 19352335

results.title: [Anesthesia for cesarean section in a patient with familiar hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: case report.].
results.text_hl: The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ was medicated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, with control of symptoms and @DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@cardiac arrhythmias@@@.

citations.NLM: Stocche RM, Garcia LV, Klamt JG. [Anesthesia for cesarean section in a patient with familiar hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: case report.]. Rev Bras Anestesiol. 2007 Dec;57(6):665-71. PMID: 19462143
